item.title: Stock Futures Rise, Dollar Dips on EU Tariff Delay: Markets Wrap
item.description: US and European equity-index futures climbed as President Donald Trump extended a deadline on aggressive European tariffs, boosting optimism after whipsawing on Friday.
item.dc:creator: Anand Krishnamoorthy

media:content.media:description: A trader works on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) during the Hinge Health Inc. initial public offering (IPO) in New York, US, on Thursday, May 22, 2025. Hinge Health Inc. and a group of investors raised $437 million in the digital physical therapy provider's US initial public offering, pricing shares at the top of a marketed range.

item.title: Meiji Yasuda’s Paper Bond Losses Jump Eightfold as Rates Climb
item.description: Meiji Yasuda Life Insurance Co. said that unrealized losses on its domestic bond holdings increased more than eightfold last fiscal year, in the latest sign of how climbing interest rates are weighing on the portfolios of Japanese insurers.
item.dc:creator: Nao Sano, Taiga Uranaka

media:content.media:description: The Meiji Yasuda Life Insurance headquarters in Tokyo.

item.title: European Stock Futures Rise as Trump Extends Tariff Deadline
item.description: European stock index futures gained after President Donald Trump said he would extend the deadline for the European Union to face higher tariffs, as investors weigh prospects for longer-term trade deal.
item.dc:creator: Winnie Hsu

item.title: GMO Group Scraps $2 Billion Share Sale Plan of Internet Unit
item.description: The Japanese conglomerate GMO Internet Group Inc. canceled a planned share offering of one of its listed arms after the stock surged in recent months, pushing up the unit’s valuation.
item.dc:creator: Yasutaka Tamura

item.title: Dollar Extends Drop as EU Tariff Delay Boosts Risk-Sensitive FX
item.description: A gauge of the dollar slid toward its lowest level in nearly two years after US President Donald Trump’s decision to postpone higher tariffs on the European Union boosted other currencies with strong links to global trade.
item.dc:creator: Masaki Kondo

item.title: Emerging Currencies Advance as Trump Extends EU Tariff Deadline
item.description: A gauge of emerging-market currencies rallied to a record high as Washington’s decision to extend the deadline for aggressive tariffs on the European Union bolstered risk appetite.
item.dc:creator: Jaehyun Eom

item.title: 'Stars Align' For Emerging Markets: Morgan Stanley
item.description: Amy Oldenburg, the Head of Emerging Markets Equity for Morgan Stanley Investment Management, speaks on Bloomberg's Insight with Haslinda Amin about investment opportunities in emerging markets. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Goldman Sachs Expects Stronger Yuan to Boost Chinese Stocks
item.description: Chinese stocks are expected to benefit from further gains in the yuan, which has been showing resilience amid the country’s trade spat with the US, according to strategists at Goldman Sachs Group Inc.
item.dc:creator: Winnie Hsu, Wenjin Lv

item.title: Fed's Kashkari Says Shock of Tariffs Is 'Stagflationary'
item.description: Federal Reserve Bank of Minneapolis President Neel Kashkari says "there's no question the shock of tariffs is stagflationary," adding that the magnitude depends on the rate of the trade levies and time period involved. Kashkari speaks with Haslinda Amin on Bloomberg Television. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Chinese EV Stocks Tumble After BYD Slashes Prices Up to 35%
item.description: BYD Co. led Chinese electric vehicle stocks lower in Hong Kong on Monday, as investors digested the auto giant’s sweeping price cuts of as much as 35% late last week.
item.dc:creator: Danny Lee

media:content.media:description: A BYD Seal. Photographer: SeongJoon Cho/Bloomberg

item.title: Oil Steadies as Traders Weigh Trump’s Tariff Pledge on EU Goods
item.description: Oil was steady as the market weighed the outlook for easing trade tensions after President Donald Trump said he would extend the deadline for the European Union to face so-called reciprocal tariffs.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Chen

item.title: Indian Stocks May Benefit From Weak US Dollar, Delayed EU Tariffs
item.description: Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:
item.dc:creator: Ashutosh Joshi

item.title: Japan Sovereign Bonds Trim Recent Losses That Rattled Investors
item.description: Japan’s super-long yields are pulling back from record highs, but investors remain cautious before a 40-year bond auction on Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: Mia Glass

item.title: Record India Private Credit Deal Hinges on Tricky Collateral
item.description: On the surface, India’s record-breaking private credit deal is a milestone for the market.
item.dc:creator: Nic Querolo, Saikat Das, Divya Patil

media:content.media:description: The headquarters of Shapoorji Pallonji Group in Mumbai on May 14.

item.title: Chinese Steel Exports to Drop as Barriers Mount, Says Goldman
item.description: The blowout in Chinese steel exports has likely peaked, as trade barriers mount and domestic production falls, according to Goldman Sachs Group Inc.
item.dc:creator: Jason Rogers

item.title: Trump Backing for a Nippon Steel Deal Leaves Big Questions
item.description: After more than 17 months of lobbying and close-fought negotiations to secure control of United States Steel Corp., Japan’s Nippon Steel Corp. appeared on Friday to have received a presidential blessing.
item.dc:creator: Tony Czuczka, Toshiro Hasegawa

media:content.media:description: The United States Steel Corp. Clairton Coke Works along the banks of the Monongahela River in Clairton, Pennsylvania, US, on Monday, Aug. 14, 2023. US Steel surged after it rejected a takeover offer from rival Cleveland-Cliffs Inc. to create one of the world's biggest steelmakers, and said it will begin a review of its strategic options instead.

item.title: Long-Bond Revolt Pressures 60/40 Comeback in Chaotic Market
item.description: A slump in the US long bond is clouding the comeback of a classic investment strategy.
item.dc:creator: Ye Xie, Liz Capo McCormick, Joel Leon

media:content.media:description: A trader works on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) in New York, US, on Wednesday, May 7, 2025. Federal Reserve officials held interest rates steady for a third-straight meeting and emphasized they see a growing risk of both higher inflation and rising unemployment.

item.title: Philippine Peso Advances to Strongest Since 2023 on Dollar, Oil
item.description: The Philippine peso rose to its strongest level in almost two years against the dollar, buoyed by weakness in the US currency and oil prices.
item.dc:creator: Marcus Wong

item.title: Japan’s Stocks Rise as Trump Rhetoric Cools; Nippon Steel Climbs
item.description: Japan’s shares gained on hopes of softer trade policies from US President Donald Trump, after he extended the deadline for higher duties on European Union goods and backed a deal between Nippon Steel Corp. and US Steel Corp.
item.dc:creator: Alice French, Toshiro Hasegawa

item.title: WiseTech Buys E2Open for $2.1 Billion in Its Biggest Deal
item.description: Australian shipping software company WiseTech Global Ltd. made its biggest ever acquisition, agreeing to buy E2open Parent Holdings Inc. in a deal that values the US firm at $2.1 billion.
item.dc:creator: Peter Vercoe

media:content.media:description: Richard White, chief executive officer of WiseTech Global Ltd., speaks during the Morgan Stanley Australia Summit in Sydney, Australia, on Wednesday, June 12, 2024. The Summit will continue through June 13.

item.title: Thai FM Calls for Joining Global Supply Chains
item.description: Thailand's Foreign Minister Maris Sangiampongsa urged ASEAN countries to pursue stronger integration into global supply chains to benefit from economies of scale and gain better access to larger markets. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Trump Extends Deadline for 50% Tariffs on EU Goods
item.description: President Donald Trump said he would extend the deadline for the European Union to face 50% tariffs until July 9 after a phone call with Commission President Ursula von der Leyen. Bloomberg News Editor News Editor Tony Czuczka shares what we know so far. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Won May Extend Rally on Easing Political Risks, Trade Deal Bets
item.description: The South Korean won is attracting a growing number of bullish calls from analysts, who expect the country’s trade negotiations with the US and easing political uncertainties to extend a recent rally.
item.dc:creator: Jaehyun Eom

item.title: Gold Slips as Haven Demand Eases After Trump Delays EU Tariffs
item.description: Gold slipped as its haven status was impacted by signs President Donald Trump may be easing his aggressive stance on trade with the European Union, after he extended a deadline on sweeping tariff measures.
item.dc:creator: Sybilla Gross

item.title: Five Key Charts to Watch in Global Commodity Markets This Week
item.description: Chicken is going to be harder to come by in markets from China to Europe after a case of bird flu was detected in top exporter Brazil. Summer is just around the corner in the Northern Hemisphere, prompting forecasts for hurricanes as well as predictions about gasoline demand in the US. And the Democratic Republic of the Congo — dubbed the “Saudi Arabia of cobalt” — is becoming a player in the trade war between China and the US.
item.dc:creator: Simar Khanna

media:content.media:description: ISA Brown chickens in a chicken coop at an egg farm in Mason, Michigan, US, on Monday, March 3, 2025. Egg prices have soared to a record of over $8 a dozen, driven by the worst-ever outbreak of avian flu in the US and contributing to broader inflation pressures.

item.title: Treasury Traders Enter Abridged Week With Inflation Top of Mind
item.description: Weary bond investors enter a holiday-shortened week facing fresh US inflation readings at a time when consumers are already anticipating steeper prices pressures given President Donald Trump’s tariff plans.
item.dc:creator: Liz Capo McCormick

item.title: Banco BPM Appeals Italy Regulator’s Delay of UniCredit Bid
item.description: Banco BPM SpA is seeking to block Italy’s market regulator from delaying a proposed takeover of the bank by UniCredit SpA, as part of an escalating legal battle over the deal.
item.dc:creator: Sonia Sirletti, Vernon Silver

media:content.media:description: A Banco BPM SpA bank branch in Milan, Italy, on Friday, Nov. 29, 2024. The Italian government is examining ways to counter UniCredit SpA’s unsolicited takeover bid for smaller Italian rival Banco BPM.

item.title: Shipping Bottlenecks in Europe Send a Warning Signal to US, Asia
item.description: Port congestion is worsening at key gateways in northern Europe and other hubs, according to a new report which suggests trade wars could spread maritime disruptions to Asia and the US and push up shipping rates.
item.dc:creator: Brendan Murray

media:content.media:description: The container terminal at Bremerhaven port in Bremerhaven, Germany, on April 22, 2025.

item.title: Elusive Peace Hits Ukraine’s Bonds While Neighbor Markets Surge
item.description: One of the most popular emerging-market trades around Donald Trump’s return to the White House is stumbling.
item.dc:creator: Andras Gergely, Jorgelina Do Rosario

item.title: What’s Happening in EM: Ukraine Bond Trade Loses Steam (Podcast)
item.description: Andras Gergely talks with Zijia Song about how one of the hottest emerging markets trades from earlier this year is now losing steam, as the hopes for a rapid Ukraine peace deal dim.
item.dc:creator: Zijia Song
